results.title: Kakadu: Land of the Crocodile
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Wilderness is increasingly recognised as a scarce and vital commodity worldwide. In this video, Part 2 in a series of 6 documentaries, Val Plumwood, environmental philosopher and writer returns to Kakadu, where she was the victim of a terrible crocodile attack. Set against the steamy, intensely beautiful, backdrop of Kakadu National Park viewers share her thoughts on wilderness and wildlife. Accompanied by a Teacher’s Guide.

results.title: The Australian Alps: Mirka's Palace of Dreams
results.creator_credit: David Greig, David Morgan and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
This program is the last in a series of 6 documentaries that examine the wilderness areas of Australia.
Mirka Mora is an eccentric artist, French by birth, who had never before ventured into the wilderness nor slept in a tent. Along with Tim McCartney Snape, the first Australian ever to reach the summit of Mt. Everest, and a Nepalese Sherpa, she travels into the Kosciusko wilderness. Mirka’s unique and expressive personality helps viewers see and experience this wilderness from an artist’s perspective. A Teacher’s guide accompanies the video.
results.title_for_label: The Australian Alps: Mirka’s Palace of Dreams

results.title: Ibrahim
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Material Production Curriculum Branch Education Dept of Victoria
results.brief_description: This film has been made to provoke discussion of issues about racial prejudice. It tells the story of Ibrahim, a twelve-year-old Lebanese boy, who comes to Melbourne from war-torn Beirut. He goes straight into a post-primary school knowing no English and haunted by the horrors he has seen. Cast includes Sherif Abada. Based on a story by Jane Watson. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Spag [released version]
results.brief_description: Director Giorgio Mangiamele produced the first examples of multicultural cinema in this country. ‘The Spag’ was shot in the streets of Carlton and tells the story of a newspaper boy working to support his widowed mother; along the way his life is fraught with racism. The film is Neo-Realist in style and makes interesting use of incidental music and post-sync dubbed dialogue track; a dog’s bark is even mimicked by an actor’s voice. Stars the young Terry Donovan.

holdings.name: 16mm film; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: The Devil's toy
results.creator_credit: Claude Jutra, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The skateboard gave the youngsters, who mastered its technique, a thrilling sensation of speed unexcelled by any other pavement sport. Filmed in 1966 on Montreal streets before the elongated rollerskate was banned, this film captures the exuberance of boys and girls having the time of their lives in free-wheeling downhill locomotion. Music by Pierre Brault. Sung by Genevieve Bujold.

results.title: Media Education (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Children must learn to evaluate and understand the language of media forms. By actively participating in media studies classes, film making, role playing and newscasting, they learn to question what they see and read, and become more aware of good and bad production

results.title: Are girls calculating?
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This videotape can be used not only in the maths-science classroom to encourage girls to see the importance of maths, but also as a valuable resource for careers teachers, and for social science units on either the workforce or sexism in society.

results.title: Frankston Motor Cycle Park
results.brief_description: Trailbike riding causes damage to the environment and violence and aggravation between riders and local residents. This video was made to give councils, police and motor-cycle clubs some starting points and pointers towards developing their own locally appropriate solution

results.title: Advance Australia
results.creator_credit: Dept of the Interior and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: An interpretation of the Australian way of life, set against a background showing phases of Australia’s land, cities, natural resources, primary and secondary industries, arts, sports, recreations, and potentialities. Suitable for secondary school level.
